reviews.review_msg:
The textbook is huge for one. The tests come from the textbooks and discussions in class, have to write at least 4 personal reflections and the group projects are enlightening. 
Natasha is nice and a great instructor nonetheless.
Talks fast. Lectures are short but most test questions come from textbook. Easy class as mostly personal reflections.
She's very caring and understanding. I had lots of trouble with covid and she was the best.

She was very sweet and super helpful, but she often went on on her own. She doesn't focus much on the textbook, however the final exams are based solely on textbook knowledge and applying it. Advice: For the group presentation, ensure that you use a lot of videos or clips to show your effort.
Will take another psyc course with her next term. Good teacher.

extremely terrible and stressful course. Expects you to read the textbook with lots of info. Tests and exams are really tough with very low average. I used to want to have psyc as my major but after this course, I just gave up.
She only teaches us briefly in each chapters. We need to read 70% of the textbook ourselves to do the test. Not very good at teaching.
Boring lectures. Speak so fast. The lectures are not well-organised. Need to read the textbook which she would not covered in detail during the lesson by yourself in order to do the tests.
Natasha is great, very nice and helpful. I like her lectures it is pretty interesting, but she talks a bit fast so it's hard to keep up when taking notes. Other than that she is super nice.
Natasha was funny and use examples to help. Classes too long! 4hours!
Very fast. In fact, the fastest teacher when it comes to talking. Don't bother taking smart notes cos you'll get confused most times.
I take class at FIC. Good professor. always give examples to help class.
